etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek keanōthos, denoting a kind of thistle

definitions: a North American shrub of the buckthorn family, cultivated for its dense clusters of small blue or white flowers.

notes.text: Genus Ceanothus, family Rhamnaceae: numerous species, especially in the western US, including the blueblossom ceanothus of the Pacific coast

shortDefinitions: North American shrub which is cultivated for its dense clusters of small flowers
